<Link id="l00008" /><CodeLine lineNumber="8"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00009" /><CodeLine lineNumber="9"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// \\file</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00010" /><CodeLine lineNumber="10"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Interface file for the IRSimilarityIdentifier for identifying similarities in</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00011" /><CodeLine lineNumber="11"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// IR including the IRInstructionMapper, which maps an Instruction to unsigned</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00012" /><CodeLine lineNumber="12"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// integers.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00013" /><CodeLine lineNumber="13"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00014" /><CodeLine lineNumber="14"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Two sequences of instructions are called &quot;similar&quot; if they perform the same</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00015" /><CodeLine lineNumber="15"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// series of operations for all inputs.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00016" /><CodeLine lineNumber="16"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00017" /><CodeLine lineNumber="17"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// \\code</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00018" /><CodeLine lineNumber="18"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// %1 = add i32 %a, 10</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00019" /><CodeLine lineNumber="19"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// %2 = add i32 %a, %1</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00020" /><CodeLine lineNumber="20"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// %3 = icmp slt icmp %1, %2</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00021" /><CodeLine lineNumber="21"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// \\endcode</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00022" /><CodeLine lineNumber="22"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00023" /><CodeLine lineNumber="23"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// and</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00024" /><CodeLine lineNumber="24"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00025" /><CodeLine lineNumber="25"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// \\code</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00026" /><CodeLine lineNumber="26"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// %1 = add i32 11, %a</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00027" /><CodeLine lineNumber="27"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// %2 = sub i32 %a, %1</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00028" /><CodeLine lineNumber="28"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// %3 = icmp sgt icmp %2, %1</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00029" /><CodeLine lineNumber="29"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// \\endcode</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00030" /><CodeLine lineNumber="30"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00031" /><CodeLine lineNumber="31"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// ultimately have the same result, even if the inputs, and structure are</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00032" /><CodeLine lineNumber="32"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// slightly different.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00033" /><CodeLine lineNumber="33"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00034" /><CodeLine lineNumber="34"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// For instructions, we do not worry about operands that do not have fixed</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00035" /><CodeLine lineNumber="35"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// semantic meaning to the program.  We consider the opcode that the instruction</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00036" /><CodeLine lineNumber="36"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// has, the types, parameters, and extra information such as the function name,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00037" /><CodeLine lineNumber="37"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// or comparison predicate.  These are used to create a hash to map instructions</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00038" /><CodeLine lineNumber="38"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// to integers to be used in similarity matching in sequences of instructions</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00039" /><CodeLine lineNumber="39"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00040" /><CodeLine lineNumber="40"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Terminology:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00041" /><CodeLine lineNumber="41"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// An IRSimilarityCandidate is a region of IRInstructionData (wrapped</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00042" /><CodeLine lineNumber="42"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Instructions), usually used to denote a region of similarity has been found.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00043" /><CodeLine lineNumber="43"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00044" /><CodeLine lineNumber="44"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// A SimilarityGroup is a set of IRSimilarityCandidates that are structurally</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00045" /><CodeLine lineNumber="45"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// similar to one another.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00046" /><CodeLine lineNumber="46"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00047" /><CodeLine lineNumber="47"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//===----------------------------------------------------------------------===//</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00064" /><CodeLine lineNumber="64"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00065" /><CodeLine lineNumber="65"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// This represents what is and is not supported when finding similarity in</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00066" /><CodeLine lineNumber="66"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// Instructions.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00067" /><CodeLine lineNumber="67"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00068" /><CodeLine lineNumber="68"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// Legal Instructions are considered when looking at similarity between</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00069" /><CodeLine lineNumber="69"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// Instructions.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00070" /><CodeLine lineNumber="70"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00071" /><CodeLine lineNumber="71"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// Illegal Instructions cannot be considered when looking for similarity</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00072" /><CodeLine lineNumber="72"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// between Instructions. They act as boundaries between similarity regions.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00073" /><CodeLine lineNumber="73"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00074" /><CodeLine lineNumber="74"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// Invisible Instructions are skipped over during analysis.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00075" /><CodeLine lineNumber="75"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// TODO: Shared with MachineOutliner</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00076" /><CodeLine lineNumber="76" lineLink="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/irsimilarity/#af46430106334db52bfa7a4107e53a0bda16a84ba67d52e1c64fb48ce437b569ab"><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">enum</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/irsimilarity/#af46430106334db52bfa7a4107e53a0bd">InstrType</a> &#123; <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/irsimilarity/#af46430106334db52bfa7a4107e53a0bda8f7357506e00d8cd0694f948f909865d">Legal</a>, <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/irsimilarity/#af46430106334db52bfa7a4107e53a0bda16a84ba67d52e1c64fb48ce437b569ab">Illegal</a>, <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/irsimilarity/#af46430106334db52bfa7a4107e53a0bda47b7bba75c0c242b40fece427c2bfefa">Invisible</a> &#125;;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00077" /><CodeLine lineNumber="77"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00078" /><CodeLine lineNumber="78"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// This provides the utilities for hashing an Instruction to an unsigned</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00079" /><CodeLine lineNumber="79"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// integer. Two IRInstructionDatas produce the same hash value when their</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00080" /><CodeLine lineNumber="80"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// underlying Instructions perform the same operation (even if they don&#39;t have</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00081" /><CodeLine lineNumber="81"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// the same input operands.)</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00082" /><CodeLine lineNumber="82"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// As a more concrete example, consider the following:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00083" /><CodeLine lineNumber="83"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00084" /><CodeLine lineNumber="84"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// \\code</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00085" /><CodeLine lineNumber="85"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// %add1 = add i32 %a, %b</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00086" /><CodeLine lineNumber="86"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// %add2 = add i32 %c, %d</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00087" /><CodeLine lineNumber="87"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// %add3 = add i64 %e, %f</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00088" /><CodeLine lineNumber="88"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// \\endcode</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00089" /><CodeLine lineNumber="89"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00090" /><CodeLine lineNumber="90"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Then the IRInstructionData wrappers for these Instructions may be hashed like</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00091" /><CodeLine lineNumber="91"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// so:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00092" /><CodeLine lineNumber="92"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00093" /><CodeLine lineNumber="93"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// \\code</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00094" /><CodeLine lineNumber="94"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// ; These two adds have the same types and operand types, so they hash to the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00095" /><CodeLine lineNumber="95"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// ; same number.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00096" /><CodeLine lineNumber="96"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// %add1 = add i32 %a, %b ; Hash: 1</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00097" /><CodeLine lineNumber="97"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// %add2 = add i32 %c, %d ; Hash: 1</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00098" /><CodeLine lineNumber="98"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// ; This add produces an i64. This differentiates it from %add1 and %add2. So,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00099" /><CodeLine lineNumber="99"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// ; it hashes to a different number.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00100" /><CodeLine lineNumber="100"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// %add3 = add i64 %e, %f; Hash: 2</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00101" /><CodeLine lineNumber="101"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// \\endcode</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00102" /><CodeLine lineNumber="102"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00103" /><CodeLine lineNumber="103"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00104" /><CodeLine lineNumber="104"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// This hashing scheme will be used to represent the program as a very long</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00105" /><CodeLine lineNumber="105"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// string. This string can then be placed in a data structure which can be used</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00106" /><CodeLine lineNumber="106"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// for similarity queries.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00107" /><CodeLine lineNumber="107"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00108" /><CodeLine lineNumber="108"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// TODO: Handle types of Instructions which can be equal even with different</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00109" /><CodeLine lineNumber="109"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// operands. (E.g. comparisons with swapped predicates.)</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00110" /><CodeLine lineNumber="110"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// TODO: Handle CallInsts, which are only checked for function type</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00111" /><CodeLine lineNumber="111"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// by \\ref isSameOperationAs.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00112" /><CodeLine lineNumber="112"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// TODO: Handle GetElementPtrInsts, as some of the operands have to be the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00113" /><CodeLine lineNumber="113"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// exact same, and some do not.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00114" /><CodeLine lineNumber="114" lineLink="/docs/api/structs/llvm/irsimilarity/irinstructiondata"><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">struct </span><span class="doxyHighlight"><a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/irsimilarity/irinstructiondata/#a31d26022f657b77aa802a9190611e87b">IRInstructionData</a></span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00115" /><CodeLine lineNumber="115"><span class="doxyHighlight">    : <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/ilist-node">ilist&#95;node</a>&lt;IRInstructionData, ilist&#95;sentinel&#95;tracking&lt;true&gt;&gt; &#123;</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00118" /><CodeLine lineNumber="118" lineLink="/docs/api/structs/llvm/irsimilarity/irinstructiondata/#a8f280453f9963266308cb61e428f5268"><span class="doxyHighlight">  <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/instruction">Instruction</a> &#42;<a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/irsimilarity/irinstructiondata/#a8f280453f9963266308cb61e428f5268">Inst</a> = </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">nullptr</span><span class="doxyHighlight">;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00119" /><CodeLine lineNumber="119"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// The values of the operands in the Instruction.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00120" /><CodeLine lineNumber="120" lineLink="/docs/api/structs/llvm/irsimilarity/irinstructiondata/#ab39a288c69393c860063b5d0348dc05a"><span class="doxyHighlight">  <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/smallvector">SmallVector&lt;Value &#42;, 4&gt;</a> <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/irsimilarity/irinstructiondata/#ab39a288c69393c860063b5d0348dc05a">OperVals</a>;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00121" /><CodeLine lineNumber="121"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// The legality of the wrapped instruction. This is informed by InstrType,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00122" /><CodeLine lineNumber="122"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// and is used when checking when two instructions are considered similar.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00123" /><CodeLine lineNumber="123"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// If either instruction is not legal, the instructions are automatically not</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00124" /><CodeLine lineNumber="124"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// considered similar.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00125" /><CodeLine lineNumber="125" lineLink="/docs/api/structs/llvm/irsimilarity/irinstructiondata/#ad05fd093f3eb994c056a4d353684aaf8"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">bool</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/irsimilarity/irinstructiondata/#ad05fd093f3eb994c056a4d353684aaf8">Legal</a> = </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">false</span><span class="doxyHighlight">;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00126" /><CodeLine lineNumber="126"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00127" /><CodeLine lineNumber="127"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// This is only relevant if we are wrapping a CmpInst where we needed to</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00128" /><CodeLine lineNumber="128"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// change the predicate of a compare instruction from a greater than form</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00129" /><CodeLine lineNumber="129"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// to a less than form.  It is std::nullopt otherwise.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00130" /><CodeLine lineNumber="130" lineLink="/docs/api/structs/llvm/irsimilarity/irinstructiondata/#aed3027a8796d2aa6a899077856e14da4"><span class="doxyHighlight">  std::optional&lt;CmpInst::Predicate&gt; <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/irsimilarity/irinstructiondata/#aed3027a8796d2aa6a899077856e14da4">RevisedPredicate</a>;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00131" /><CodeLine lineNumber="131"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00132" /><CodeLine lineNumber="132"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// This is only relevant if we are wrapping a CallInst. If we are requiring</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00133" /><CodeLine lineNumber="133"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// that the function calls have matching names as well as types, and the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00134" /><CodeLine lineNumber="134"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// call is not an indirect call, this will hold the name of the function.  If</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00135" /><CodeLine lineNumber="135"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// it is an indirect string, it will be the empty string.  However, if this</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00136" /><CodeLine lineNumber="136"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// requirement is not in place it will be the empty string regardless of the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00137" /><CodeLine lineNumber="137"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// function call type.  The value held here is used to create the hash of the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00138" /><CodeLine lineNumber="138"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// instruction, and check to make sure two instructions are close to one</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00139" /><CodeLine lineNumber="139"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// another.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00140" /><CodeLine lineNumber="140" lineLink="/docs/api/structs/llvm/irsimilarity/irinstructiondata/#a292aaa1e14576c8e38a2aad65d44f833"><span class="doxyHighlight">  std::optional&lt;std::string&gt; <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/irsimilarity/irinstructiondata/#a292aaa1e14576c8e38a2aad65d44f833">CalleeName</a>;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00141" /><CodeLine lineNumber="141"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00142" /><CodeLine lineNumber="142"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// This structure holds the distances of how far &quot;ahead of&quot; or &quot;behind&quot; the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00143" /><CodeLine lineNumber="143"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// target blocks of a branch, or the incoming blocks of a phi nodes are.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00144" /><CodeLine lineNumber="144"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// If the value is negative, it means that the block was registered before</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00145" /><CodeLine lineNumber="145"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// the block of this instruction in terms of blocks in the function.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00146" /><CodeLine lineNumber="146"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Code Example:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00147" /><CodeLine lineNumber="147"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// \\code</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00148" /><CodeLine lineNumber="148"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// block&#95;1:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00149" /><CodeLine lineNumber="149"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///   br i1 %0, label %block&#95;2, label %block&#95;3</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00150" /><CodeLine lineNumber="150"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// block&#95;2:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00151" /><CodeLine lineNumber="151"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///   br i1 %1, label %block&#95;1, label %block&#95;2</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00152" /><CodeLine lineNumber="152"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// block&#95;3:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00153" /><CodeLine lineNumber="153"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///   br i1 %2, label %block&#95;2, label %block&#95;1</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00154" /><CodeLine lineNumber="154"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// ; Replacing the labels with relative values, this becomes:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00155" /><CodeLine lineNumber="155"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// block&#95;1:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00156" /><CodeLine lineNumber="156"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///   br i1 %0, distance 1, distance 2</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00157" /><CodeLine lineNumber="157"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// block&#95;2:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00158" /><CodeLine lineNumber="158"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///   br i1 %1, distance -1, distance 0</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00159" /><CodeLine lineNumber="159"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// block&#95;3:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00160" /><CodeLine lineNumber="160"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///   br i1 %2, distance -1, distance -2</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00161" /><CodeLine lineNumber="161"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// \\endcode</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00162" /><CodeLine lineNumber="162"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Taking block&#95;2 as our example, block&#95;1 is &quot;behind&quot; block&#95;2, and block&#95;2 is</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00163" /><CodeLine lineNumber="163"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// &quot;ahead&quot; of block&#95;2.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00164" /><CodeLine lineNumber="164" lineLink="/docs/api/structs/llvm/irsimilarity/irinstructiondata/#a2606c92d4c122037d9065123c3db3093"><span class="doxyHighlight">  <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/smallvector">SmallVector&lt;int, 4&gt;</a> <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/irsimilarity/irinstructiondata/#a2606c92d4c122037d9065123c3db3093">RelativeBlockLocations</a>;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00165" /><CodeLine lineNumber="165"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00166" /><CodeLine lineNumber="166"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Gather the information that is difficult to gather for an Instruction, or</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00167" /><CodeLine lineNumber="167"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// is changed. i.e. the operands of an Instruction and the Types of those</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00168" /><CodeLine lineNumber="168"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// operands. This extra information allows for similarity matching to make</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00192" /><CodeLine lineNumber="192"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00193" /><CodeLine lineNumber="193"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// For an IRInstructionData containing a branch, finds the</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00202" /><CodeLine lineNumber="202"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00203" /><CodeLine lineNumber="203"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// For an IRInstructionData containing a CallInst, set the function name</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00204" /><CodeLine lineNumber="204"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// appropriately.  This will be an empty string if it is an indirect call,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00205" /><CodeLine lineNumber="205"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// or we are not matching by name of the called function.  It will be the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00206" /><CodeLine lineNumber="206"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// name of the function if \\p MatchByName is true and it is not an indirect</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00207" /><CodeLine lineNumber="207"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// call.  We may decide not to match by name in order to expand the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00208" /><CodeLine lineNumber="208"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// size of the regions we can match.  If a function name has the same type</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00209" /><CodeLine lineNumber="209"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// signature, but the different name, the region of code is still almost the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00210" /><CodeLine lineNumber="210"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// same.  Since function names can be treated as constants, the name itself</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00211" /><CodeLine lineNumber="211"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// could be extrapolated away.  However, matching by name provides a</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00212" /><CodeLine lineNumber="212"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// specificity and more &quot;identical&quot; code than not matching by name.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00213" /><CodeLine lineNumber="213"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00214" /><CodeLine lineNumber="214"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// \\param MatchByName - A flag to mark whether we are using the called</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00215" /><CodeLine lineNumber="215"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// function name as a differentiating parameter.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00216" /><CodeLine lineNumber="216"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">void</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/irsimilarity/irinstructiondata/#ae0683ad49b9a0ccca8bd1c97987a8cf9">setCalleeName</a>(</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">bool</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> MatchByName = </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">true</span><span class="doxyHighlight">);</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00232" /><CodeLine lineNumber="232"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00233" /><CodeLine lineNumber="233"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Hashes \\p Value based on its opcode, types, and operand types.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00234" /><CodeLine lineNumber="234"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Two IRInstructionData instances produce the same hash when they perform</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00235" /><CodeLine lineNumber="235"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// the same operation.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00236" /><CodeLine lineNumber="236"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00237" /><CodeLine lineNumber="237"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// As a simple example, consider the following instructions.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00238" /><CodeLine lineNumber="238"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00239" /><CodeLine lineNumber="239"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// \\code</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00240" /><CodeLine lineNumber="240"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// %add1 = add i32 %x1, %y1</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00241" /><CodeLine lineNumber="241"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// %add2 = add i32 %x2, %y2</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00242" /><CodeLine lineNumber="242"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00243" /><CodeLine lineNumber="243"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// %sub = sub i32 %x1, %y1</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00244" /><CodeLine lineNumber="244"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00245" /><CodeLine lineNumber="245"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// %add&#95;i64 = add i64 %x2, %y2</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00246" /><CodeLine lineNumber="246"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// \\endcode</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00247" /><CodeLine lineNumber="247"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00248" /><CodeLine lineNumber="248"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Because the first two adds operate the same types, and are performing the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00249" /><CodeLine lineNumber="249"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// same action, they will be hashed to the same value.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00250" /><CodeLine lineNumber="250"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00251" /><CodeLine lineNumber="251"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// However, the subtraction instruction is not the same as an addition, and</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00252" /><CodeLine lineNumber="252"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// will be hashed to a different value.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00253" /><CodeLine lineNumber="253"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00254" /><CodeLine lineNumber="254"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Finally, the last add has a different type compared to the first two add</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00255" /><CodeLine lineNumber="255"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// instructions, so it will also be hashed to a different value that any of</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00256" /><CodeLine lineNumber="256"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// the previous instructions.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00257" /><CodeLine lineNumber="257"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00258" /><CodeLine lineNumber="258"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// \\param &#91;in&#93; ID - The IRInstructionData instance to be hashed.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00259" /><CodeLine lineNumber="259"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// \\returns A hash&#95;value of the IRInstructionData.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00260" /><CodeLine lineNumber="260" lineLink="/docs/api/structs/llvm/irsimilarity/irinstructiondata/#ac3fdb189d1625b937b2aedcf1de64f09"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">friend</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/hash-code">hash&#95;code</a> <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/irsimilarity/irinstructiondata/#ac3fdb189d1625b937b2aedcf1de64f09">hash&#95;value</a>(</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">const</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/irsimilarity/irinstructiondata/#a31d26022f657b77aa802a9190611e87b">IRInstructionData</a> &amp;<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/callingconv/#abdf8cf606905c10634e831390981b0ed">ID</a>) &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00261" /><CodeLine lineNumber="261"><span class="doxyHighlight">    <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/smallvector">SmallVector&lt;Type &#42;, 4&gt;</a> OperTypes;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00262" /><CodeLine lineNumber="262"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">for</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/value">Value</a> &#42;V : <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/callingconv/#abdf8cf606905c10634e831390981b0ed">ID</a>.OperVals)</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00263" /><CodeLine lineNumber="263"><span class="doxyHighlight">      OperTypes.<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/smallvectortemplatebase/#af42bfbc067df27c19ee2fc859df58799">push&#95;back</a>(V-&gt;getType());</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00264" /><CodeLine lineNumber="264"></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00305" /><CodeLine lineNumber="305"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// Compare one IRInstructionData class to another IRInstructionData class for</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00306" /><CodeLine lineNumber="306"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// whether they are performing a the same operation, and can mapped to the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00307" /><CodeLine lineNumber="307"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// same value. For regular instructions if the hash value is the same, then</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00308" /><CodeLine lineNumber="308"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// they will also be close.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00309" /><CodeLine lineNumber="309"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00310" /><CodeLine lineNumber="310"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// \\param A - The first IRInstructionData class to compare</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00311" /><CodeLine lineNumber="311"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// \\param B - The second IRInstructionData class to compare</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00312" /><CodeLine lineNumber="312"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// \\returns true if \\p A and \\p B are similar enough to be mapped to the same</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00313" /><CodeLine lineNumber="313"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// value.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00314" /><CodeLine lineNumber="314"><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">bool</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/irsimilarity/#ad7518d710d81c7c4c04cc6a61e7d65bc">isClose</a>(</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">const</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/irsimilarity/irinstructiondata">IRInstructionData</a> &amp;<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/ir/builtingcs-cpp/#a2e38c85003a042421cde1647632d0b72">A</a>, </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">const</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/irsimilarity/irinstructiondata">IRInstructionData</a> &amp;<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/ir/builtingcs-cpp/#ae76959fe811ba090de4cba69ac00f1da">B</a>);</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00339" /><CodeLine lineNumber="339"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// Helper struct for converting the Instructions in a Module into a vector of</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00340" /><CodeLine lineNumber="340"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// unsigned integers. This vector of unsigned integers can be thought of as a</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00341" /><CodeLine lineNumber="341"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// &quot;numeric string&quot;. This numeric string can then be queried by, for example,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00342" /><CodeLine lineNumber="342"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// data structures that find repeated substrings.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00343" /><CodeLine lineNumber="343"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00344" /><CodeLine lineNumber="344"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// This hashing is done per BasicBlock in the module. To hash Instructions</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00345" /><CodeLine lineNumber="345"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// based off of their operations, each Instruction is wrapped in an</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00346" /><CodeLine lineNumber="346"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// IRInstructionData struct. The unsigned integer for an IRInstructionData</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00347" /><CodeLine lineNumber="347"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// depends on:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00348" /><CodeLine lineNumber="348"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// - The hash provided by the IRInstructionData.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00349" /><CodeLine lineNumber="349"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// - Which member of InstrType the IRInstructionData is classified as.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00350" /><CodeLine lineNumber="350"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// See InstrType for more details on the possible classifications, and how they</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00351" /><CodeLine lineNumber="351"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// manifest in the numeric string.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00352" /><CodeLine lineNumber="352"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00353" /><CodeLine lineNumber="353"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// The numeric string for an individual BasicBlock is terminated by an unique</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00354" /><CodeLine lineNumber="354"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// unsigned integer. This prevents data structures which rely on repetition</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00355" /><CodeLine lineNumber="355"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// from matching across BasicBlocks. (For example, the SuffixTree.)</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00356" /><CodeLine lineNumber="356"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// As a concrete example, if we have the following two BasicBlocks:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00357" /><CodeLine lineNumber="357"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// \\code</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00358" /><CodeLine lineNumber="358"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// bb0:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00359" /><CodeLine lineNumber="359"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// %add1 = add i32 %a, %b</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00360" /><CodeLine lineNumber="360"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// %add2 = add i32 %c, %d</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00361" /><CodeLine lineNumber="361"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// %add3 = add i64 %e, %f</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00362" /><CodeLine lineNumber="362"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// bb1:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00363" /><CodeLine lineNumber="363"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// %sub = sub i32 %c, %d</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00364" /><CodeLine lineNumber="364"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// \\endcode</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00365" /><CodeLine lineNumber="365"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// We may hash the Instructions like this (via IRInstructionData):</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00366" /><CodeLine lineNumber="366"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// \\code</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00367" /><CodeLine lineNumber="367"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// bb0:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00368" /><CodeLine lineNumber="368"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// %add1 = add i32 %a, %b ; Hash: 1</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00369" /><CodeLine lineNumber="369"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// %add2 = add i32 %c, %d; Hash: 1</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00370" /><CodeLine lineNumber="370"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// %add3 = add i64 %e, %f; Hash: 2</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00371" /><CodeLine lineNumber="371"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// bb1:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00372" /><CodeLine lineNumber="372"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// %sub = sub i32 %c, %d; Hash: 3</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00373" /><CodeLine lineNumber="373"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// %add4 = add i32 %c, %d ; Hash: 1</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00374" /><CodeLine lineNumber="374"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// \\endcode</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00375" /><CodeLine lineNumber="375"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// And produce a &quot;numeric string representation&quot; like so:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00376" /><CodeLine lineNumber="376"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// 1, 1, 2, unique&#95;integer&#95;1, 3, 1, unique&#95;integer&#95;2</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00377" /><CodeLine lineNumber="377"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00378" /><CodeLine lineNumber="378"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// TODO: This is very similar to the MachineOutliner, and should be</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00379" /><CodeLine lineNumber="379"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// consolidated into the same interface.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00380" /><CodeLine lineNumber="380" lineLink="/docs/api/structs/llvm/irsimilarity/irinstructionmapper"><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">struct </span><span class="doxyHighlight"><a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/irsimilarity/irinstructionmapper/#ab074cefd064d3c9f84f7207dbee71724">IRInstructionMapper</a> &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00381" /><CodeLine lineNumber="381"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// The starting illegal instruction number to map to.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00382" /><CodeLine lineNumber="382"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00383" /><CodeLine lineNumber="383"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Set to -3 for compatibility with DenseMapInfo&lt;unsigned&gt;.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00384" /><CodeLine lineNumber="384" lineLink="/docs/api/structs/llvm/irsimilarity/irinstructionmapper/#a60e5af3b7e239b6fdad88efbe1e861bd"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">unsigned</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/irsimilarity/irinstructionmapper/#a60e5af3b7e239b6fdad88efbe1e861bd">IllegalInstrNumber</a> = </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">static&#95;cast&lt;</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">unsigned</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">&gt;</span><span class="doxyHighlight">(-3);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00385" /><CodeLine lineNumber="385"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00386" /><CodeLine lineNumber="386"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// The next available integer to assign to a legal Instruction to.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00387" /><CodeLine lineNumber="387" lineLink="/docs/api/structs/llvm/irsimilarity/irinstructionmapper/#a586d66c347a83ddac2d4552c720d3511"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">unsigned</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/irsimilarity/irinstructionmapper/#a586d66c347a83ddac2d4552c720d3511">LegalInstrNumber</a> = 0;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00388" /><CodeLine lineNumber="388"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00389" /><CodeLine lineNumber="389"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Correspondence from IRInstructionData to unsigned integers.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00390" /><CodeLine lineNumber="390"><span class="doxyHighlight">  <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/densemap">DenseMap&lt;IRInstructionData &#42;, unsigned, IRInstructionDataTraits&gt;</a></span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00391" /><CodeLine lineNumber="391" lineLink="/docs/api/structs/llvm/irsimilarity/irinstructionmapper/#a0f22f1cd41d211cd1c0f3ada0f43d576"><span class="doxyHighlight">      <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/irsimilarity/irinstructionmapper/#a0f22f1cd41d211cd1c0f3ada0f43d576">InstructionIntegerMap</a>;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00392" /><CodeLine lineNumber="392"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00393" /><CodeLine lineNumber="393"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// A mapping for a basic block in a module to its assigned number/location</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00394" /><CodeLine lineNumber="394"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// in the module.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00395" /><CodeLine lineNumber="395" lineLink="/docs/api/structs/llvm/irsimilarity/irinstructionmapper/#ac340be8c899d6572628a6944b17110bc"><span class="doxyHighlight">  <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/densemap">DenseMap&lt;BasicBlock &#42;, unsigned&gt;</a> <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/irsimilarity/irinstructionmapper/#ac340be8c899d6572628a6944b17110bc">BasicBlockToInteger</a>;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00396" /><CodeLine lineNumber="396"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00397" /><CodeLine lineNumber="397"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Set if we added an illegal number in the previous step.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00398" /><CodeLine lineNumber="398"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Since each illegal number is unique, we only need one of them between</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00399" /><CodeLine lineNumber="399"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// each range of legal numbers. This lets us make sure we don&#39;t add more</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00400" /><CodeLine lineNumber="400"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// than one illegal number per range.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00401" /><CodeLine lineNumber="401" lineLink="/docs/api/structs/llvm/irsimilarity/irinstructionmapper/#aed7023ae0be840bc273712a9905e3c06"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">bool</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/irsimilarity/irinstructionmapper/#aed7023ae0be840bc273712a9905e3c06">AddedIllegalLastTime</a> = </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">false</span><span class="doxyHighlight">;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00402" /><CodeLine lineNumber="402"></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00405" /><CodeLine lineNumber="405"></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00408" /><CodeLine lineNumber="408" lineLink="/docs/api/structs/llvm/irsimilarity/irinstructionmapper/#aa21c1493313104ffa2d57c0379c4d145"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">bool</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/irsimilarity/irinstructionmapper/#aa21c1493313104ffa2d57c0379c4d145">HaveLegalRange</a> = </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">false</span><span class="doxyHighlight">;</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00466" /><CodeLine lineNumber="466"><span class="doxyHighlight">  &#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00467" /><CodeLine lineNumber="467"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00468" /><CodeLine lineNumber="468"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Maps the Instructions in a BasicBlock \\p BB to legal or illegal integers</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00469" /><CodeLine lineNumber="469"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// determined by \\p InstrType. Two Instructions are mapped to the same value</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00470" /><CodeLine lineNumber="470"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// if they are close as defined by the InstructionData class above.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00471" /><CodeLine lineNumber="471"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00472" /><CodeLine lineNumber="472"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// \\param &#91;in&#93; BB - The BasicBlock to be mapped to integers.</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00548" /><CodeLine lineNumber="548" lineLink="/docs/api/structs/llvm/irsimilarity/irinstructionmapper/instructionclassification/#ac2dc2efd0c7dba8c7a39689b8f88e14d"><span class="doxyHighlight">    <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/irsimilarity/#af46430106334db52bfa7a4107e53a0bd">InstrType</a> <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/irsimilarity/irinstructionmapper/instructionclassification/#ac2dc2efd0c7dba8c7a39689b8f88e14d">visitIntrinsicInst</a>(<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/intrinsicinst">IntrinsicInst</a> &amp;<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/nvptx/nvvmintrrange-cpp/#ac5804672fc0850438d63caec770647f8">II</a>) &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00549" /><CodeLine lineNumber="549"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// These are disabled due to complications in the CodeExtractor when</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00550" /><CodeLine lineNumber="550"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// outlining these instructions.  For instance, It is unclear what we</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00551" /><CodeLine lineNumber="551"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// should do when moving only the start or end lifetime instruction into</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00552" /><CodeLine lineNumber="552"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// an outlined function. Also, assume-like intrinsics could be removed</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00553" /><CodeLine lineNumber="553"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// from the region, removing arguments, causing discrepencies in the</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00558" /><CodeLine lineNumber="558"><span class="doxyHighlight">    &#125;</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00560" /><CodeLine lineNumber="560"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// is not an indirect call.</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00568" /><CodeLine lineNumber="568"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Functions marked with the swifttailcc and tailcc calling conventions</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00570" /><CodeLine lineNumber="570"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// calling convention must be passed down to the outlined function as</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00571" /><CodeLine lineNumber="571"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// well. Further, there is special handling for musttail calls as well,</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00607" /><CodeLine lineNumber="607"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Maps an Instruction to a member of InstrType.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00608" /><CodeLine lineNumber="608" lineLink="/docs/api/structs/llvm/irsimilarity/irinstructionmapper/#a7a0011906a29aacd3db06d94b41193e2"><span class="doxyHighlight">  <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/irsimilarity/irinstructionmapper/instructionclassification">InstructionClassification</a> <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/irsimilarity/irinstructionmapper/#a7a0011906a29aacd3db06d94b41193e2">InstClassifier</a>;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00609" /><CodeLine lineNumber="609"><span class="doxyHighlight">&#125;;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00610" /><CodeLine lineNumber="610"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00611" /><CodeLine lineNumber="611"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// This is a class that wraps a range of IRInstructionData from one point to</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00612" /><CodeLine lineNumber="612"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// another in the vector of IRInstructionData, which is a region of the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00613" /><CodeLine lineNumber="613"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// program.  It is also responsible for defining the structure within this</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00614" /><CodeLine lineNumber="614"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// region of instructions.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00615" /><CodeLine lineNumber="615"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00616" /><CodeLine lineNumber="616"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// The structure of a region is defined through a value numbering system</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00617" /><CodeLine lineNumber="617"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// assigned to each unique value in a region at the creation of the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00618" /><CodeLine lineNumber="618"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// IRSimilarityCandidate.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00619" /><CodeLine lineNumber="619"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00620" /><CodeLine lineNumber="620"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// For example, for each Instruction we add a mapping for each new</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00621" /><CodeLine lineNumber="621"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// value seen in that Instruction.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00622" /><CodeLine lineNumber="622"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// IR:                    Mapping Added:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00623" /><CodeLine lineNumber="623"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// %add1 = add i32 %a, c1    %add1 -&gt; 3, %a -&gt; 1, c1 -&gt; 2</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00624" /><CodeLine lineNumber="624"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// %add2 = add i32 %a, %1    %add2 -&gt; 4</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00625" /><CodeLine lineNumber="625"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// %add3 = add i32 c2, c1    %add3 -&gt; 6, c2 -&gt; 5</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00626" /><CodeLine lineNumber="626"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00627" /><CodeLine lineNumber="627"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// We can compare IRSimilarityCandidates against one another.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00628" /><CodeLine lineNumber="628"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// The \\ref isSimilar function compares each IRInstructionData against one</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00629" /><CodeLine lineNumber="629"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// another and if we have the same sequences of IRInstructionData that would</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00630" /><CodeLine lineNumber="630"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// create the same hash, we have similar IRSimilarityCandidates.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00631" /><CodeLine lineNumber="631"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00632" /><CodeLine lineNumber="632"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// We can also compare the structure of IRSimilarityCandidates. If we can</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00633" /><CodeLine lineNumber="633"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// create a mapping of registers in the region contained by one</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00634" /><CodeLine lineNumber="634"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// IRSimilarityCandidate to the region contained by different</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00635" /><CodeLine lineNumber="635"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// IRSimilarityCandidate, they can be considered structurally similar.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00636" /><CodeLine lineNumber="636"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00637" /><CodeLine lineNumber="637"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// IRSimilarityCandidate1:   IRSimilarityCandidate2:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00638" /><CodeLine lineNumber="638"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// %add1 = add i32 %a, %b    %add1 = add i32 %d, %e</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00639" /><CodeLine lineNumber="639"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// %add2 = add i32 %a, %c    %add2 = add i32 %d, %f</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00640" /><CodeLine lineNumber="640"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// %add3 = add i32 c1, c2    %add3 = add i32 c3, c4</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00641" /><CodeLine lineNumber="641"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00642" /><CodeLine lineNumber="642"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// Can have the following mapping from candidate to candidate of:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00643" /><CodeLine lineNumber="643"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// %a -&gt; %d, %b -&gt; %e, %c -&gt; %f, c1 -&gt; c3, c2 -&gt; c4</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00644" /><CodeLine lineNumber="644"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// and can be considered similar.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00645" /><CodeLine lineNumber="645"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00646" /><CodeLine lineNumber="646"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// IRSimilarityCandidate1:   IRSimilarityCandidate2:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00647" /><CodeLine lineNumber="647"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// %add1 = add i32 %a, %b    %add1 = add i32 %d, c4</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00648" /><CodeLine lineNumber="648"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// %add2 = add i32 %a, %c    %add2 = add i32 %d, %f</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00649" /><CodeLine lineNumber="649"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// %add3 = add i32 c1, c2    %add3 = add i32 c3, c4</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00650" /><CodeLine lineNumber="650"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00651" /><CodeLine lineNumber="651"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// We cannot create the same mapping since the use of c4 is not used in the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00652" /><CodeLine lineNumber="652"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// same way as %b or c2.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00653" /><CodeLine lineNumber="653" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/irsimilarity/irsimilaritycandidate"><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">class </span><span class="doxyHighlight"><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/irsimilarity/irsimilaritycandidate/#ae35aff2dc6fcdec60f53cdcfabea59f7">IRSimilarityCandidate</a> &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00654" /><CodeLine lineNumber="654"><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">private</span><span class="doxyHighlight">:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00655" /><CodeLine lineNumber="655"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// The start index of this IRSimilarityCandidate in the instruction list.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00656" /><CodeLine lineNumber="656"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">unsigned</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> StartIdx = 0;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00657" /><CodeLine lineNumber="657"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00658" /><CodeLine lineNumber="658"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// The number of instructions in this IRSimilarityCandidate.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00659" /><CodeLine lineNumber="659"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">unsigned</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> Len = 0;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00660" /><CodeLine lineNumber="660"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00661" /><CodeLine lineNumber="661"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// The first instruction in this IRSimilarityCandidate.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00662" /><CodeLine lineNumber="662"><span class="doxyHighlight">  <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/irsimilarity/irinstructiondata">IRInstructionData</a> &#42;FirstInst = </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">nullptr</span><span class="doxyHighlight">;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00663" /><CodeLine lineNumber="663"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00664" /><CodeLine lineNumber="664"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// The last instruction in this IRSimilarityCandidate.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00665" /><CodeLine lineNumber="665"><span class="doxyHighlight">  <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/irsimilarity/irinstructiondata">IRInstructionData</a> &#42;LastInst = </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">nullptr</span><span class="doxyHighlight">;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00666" /><CodeLine lineNumber="666"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00667" /><CodeLine lineNumber="667"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Global Value Numbering structures</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00668" /><CodeLine lineNumber="668"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// @&#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00669" /><CodeLine lineNumber="669"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Stores the mapping of the value to the number assigned to it in the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00670" /><CodeLine lineNumber="670"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// IRSimilarityCandidate.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00671" /><CodeLine lineNumber="671"><span class="doxyHighlight">  <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/densemap">DenseMap&lt;Value &#42;, unsigned&gt;</a> ValueToNumber;</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00788" /><CodeLine lineNumber="788"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Compare the relative locations in \\p A and \\p B and check that the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00789" /><CodeLine lineNumber="789"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// distances match if both locations are contained in the region, and that</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00790" /><CodeLine lineNumber="790"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// the branches both point outside the region if they do not.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00791" /><CodeLine lineNumber="791"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Example Region:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00792" /><CodeLine lineNumber="792"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// \\code</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00793" /><CodeLine lineNumber="793"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// entry:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00794" /><CodeLine lineNumber="794"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///   br i1 %0, label %block&#95;1, label %block&#95;3</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00795" /><CodeLine lineNumber="795"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// block&#95;0:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00796" /><CodeLine lineNumber="796"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///   br i1 %0, label %block&#95;1, label %block&#95;2</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00797" /><CodeLine lineNumber="797"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// block&#95;1:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00798" /><CodeLine lineNumber="798"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///   br i1 %0, label %block&#95;2, label %block&#95;3</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00799" /><CodeLine lineNumber="799"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// block&#95;2:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00800" /><CodeLine lineNumber="800"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///   br i1 %1, label %block&#95;1, label %block&#95;4</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00801" /><CodeLine lineNumber="801"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// block&#95;3:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00802" /><CodeLine lineNumber="802"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///   br i1 %2, label %block&#95;2, label %block&#95;5</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00803" /><CodeLine lineNumber="803"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// \\endcode</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00804" /><CodeLine lineNumber="804"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// If we compare the branches in block&#95;0 and block&#95;1 the relative values are</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00805" /><CodeLine lineNumber="805"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// 1 and 2 for both, so we consider this a match.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00806" /><CodeLine lineNumber="806"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00807" /><CodeLine lineNumber="807"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// If we compare the branches in entry and block&#95;0 the relative values are</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00808" /><CodeLine lineNumber="808"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// 2 and 3, and 1 and 2 respectively.  Since these are not the same we do not</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00809" /><CodeLine lineNumber="809"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// consider them a match.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00810" /><CodeLine lineNumber="810"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00811" /><CodeLine lineNumber="811"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// If we compare the branches in block&#95;1 and block&#95;2 the relative values are</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00812" /><CodeLine lineNumber="812"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// 1 and 2, and -1 and None respectively.  As a result we do not consider</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00813" /><CodeLine lineNumber="813"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// these to be the same</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00814" /><CodeLine lineNumber="814"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00815" /><CodeLine lineNumber="815"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// If we compare the branches in block&#95;2 and block&#95;3 the relative values are</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00816" /><CodeLine lineNumber="816"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// -1 and None for both.  We do consider these to be a match.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00817" /><CodeLine lineNumber="817"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00818" /><CodeLine lineNumber="818"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// \\param A - The first IRInstructionCandidate, relative location value,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00819" /><CodeLine lineNumber="819"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// and incoming block.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00820" /><CodeLine lineNumber="820"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// \\param B - The second IRInstructionCandidate, relative location value,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00821" /><CodeLine lineNumber="821"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// and incoming block.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00822" /><CodeLine lineNumber="822"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// \\returns true if the relative locations match.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00823" /><CodeLine lineNumber="823"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">static</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">bool</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/irsimilarity/irsimilaritycandidate/#aa8a8f00e0169503c48f26bffcf4d6646">checkRelativeLocations</a>(<a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/irsimilarity/irsimilaritycandidate/relativelocmapping">RelativeLocMapping</a> <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/ir/builtingcs-cpp/#a2e38c85003a042421cde1647632d0b72">A</a>,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00824" /><CodeLine lineNumber="824"><span class="doxyHighlight">                                     <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/irsimilarity/irsimilaritycandidate/relativelocmapping">RelativeLocMapping</a> <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/ir/builtingcs-cpp/#ae76959fe811ba090de4cba69ac00f1da">B</a>);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00825" /><CodeLine lineNumber="825"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00826" /><CodeLine lineNumber="826"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Create a mapping from the value numbering to a different separate set of</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00827" /><CodeLine lineNumber="827"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// numbers. This will serve as a guide for relating one candidate to another.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00828" /><CodeLine lineNumber="828"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// The canonical number gives use the ability identify which global value</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00829" /><CodeLine lineNumber="829"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// number in one candidate relates to the global value number in the other.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00830" /><CodeLine lineNumber="830"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00831" /><CodeLine lineNumber="831"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// \\param &#91;in, out&#93; CurrCand - The IRSimilarityCandidate to create a</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00832" /><CodeLine lineNumber="832"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// canonical numbering for.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00833" /><CodeLine lineNumber="833"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">static</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">void</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/irsimilarity/irsimilaritycandidate/#ab887db0898db0bfae23199acc51e4f48">createCanonicalMappingFor</a>(<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/irsimilarity/irsimilaritycandidate/#ae35aff2dc6fcdec60f53cdcfabea59f7">IRSimilarityCandidate</a> &amp;CurrCand);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00834" /><CodeLine lineNumber="834"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00835" /><CodeLine lineNumber="835"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Create a mapping for the value numbering of the calling</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00839" /><CodeLine lineNumber="839"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// these relationships should have the same information, just in opposite</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00842" /><CodeLine lineNumber="842"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// \\param &#91;in, out&#93; SourceCand - The IRSimilarityCandidate to create a</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00914" /><CodeLine lineNumber="914"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00915" /><CodeLine lineNumber="915"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Compare the start and end indices of the two IRSimilarityCandidates for</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00916" /><CodeLine lineNumber="916"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// whether they overlap. If the start instruction of one</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00917" /><CodeLine lineNumber="917"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// IRSimilarityCandidate is less than the end instruction of the other, and</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00918" /><CodeLine lineNumber="918"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// the start instruction of one is greater than the start instruction of the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00919" /><CodeLine lineNumber="919"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// other, they overlap.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00920" /><CodeLine lineNumber="920"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00921" /><CodeLine lineNumber="921"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// \\returns true if the IRSimilarityCandidates do not have overlapping</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00922" /><CodeLine lineNumber="922"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// instructions.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00923" /><CodeLine lineNumber="923"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">static</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">bool</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/irsimilarity/irsimilaritycandidate/#ad02bc9bd1feca133eb84b3618e93fb37">overlap</a>(</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">const</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/irsimilarity/irsimilaritycandidate">IRSimilarityCandidate</a> &amp;<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/ir/builtingcs-cpp/#a2e38c85003a042421cde1647632d0b72">A</a>,</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01018" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1018" lineLink="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/irsimilarity/#a2198f86ce16da838bdeea4de7e59ef31"><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">typedef</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> std::vector&lt;IRSimilarityCandidate&gt; <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/irsimilarity/#a2198f86ce16da838bdeea4de7e59ef31">SimilarityGroup</a>;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01019" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1019" lineLink="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/irsimilarity/#a1e2d2e59b2467bacdc6db54dcc9bc4a1"><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">typedef</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> std::vector&lt;SimilarityGroup&gt; <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/irsimilarity/#a1e2d2e59b2467bacdc6db54dcc9bc4a1">SimilarityGroupList</a>;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01020" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1020"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01021" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1021"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// This class puts all the pieces of the IRInstructionData,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01022" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1022"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// IRInstructionMapper, IRSimilarityCandidate together.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01023" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1023"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01024" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1024"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// It first feeds the Module or vector of Modules into the IRInstructionMapper,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01025" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1025"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// and puts all the mapped instructions into a single long list of</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01026" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1026"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// IRInstructionData.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01027" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1027"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01028" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1028"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// The list of unsigned integers is given to the Suffix Tree or similar data</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01029" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1029"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// structure to find repeated subsequences.  We construct an</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01030" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1030"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// IRSimilarityCandidate for each instance of the subsequence.  We compare them</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01031" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1031"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// against one another since  These repeated subsequences can have different</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01032" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1032"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// structure.  For each different kind of structure found, we create a</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01033" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1033"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// similarity group.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01034" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1034"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01035" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1035"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// If we had four IRSimilarityCandidates A, B, C, and D where A, B and D are</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01036" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1036"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// structurally similar to one another, while C is different we would have two</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01037" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1037"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// SimilarityGroups:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01038" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1038"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01039" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1039"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// SimilarityGroup 1:  SimilarityGroup 2</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01040" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1040"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// A, B, D             C</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01041" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1041"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01042" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1042"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// A list of the different similarity groups is then returned after</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01043" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1043"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// analyzing the module.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01044" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1044" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/irsimilarity/irsimilarityidentifier"><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">class </span><span class="doxyHighlight"><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/irsimilarity/irsimilarityidentifier/#a3c4131532750c5351e0baa4adfd59011">IRSimilarityIdentifier</a> &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01045" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1045"><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">public</span><span class="doxyHighlight">:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01046" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1046" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/irsimilarity/irsimilarityidentifier/#a3c4131532750c5351e0baa4adfd59011"><span class="doxyHighlight">  <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/irsimilarity/irsimilarityidentifier/#a3c4131532750c5351e0baa4adfd59011">IRSimilarityIdentifier</a>(</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">bool</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> MatchBranches = </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">true</span><span class="doxyHighlight">,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01047" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1047"><span class="doxyHighlight">                         </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">bool</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> MatchIndirectCalls = </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">true</span><span class="doxyHighlight">,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01048" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1048"><span class="doxyHighlight">                         </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">bool</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> MatchCallsWithName = </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">false</span><span class="doxyHighlight">,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01049" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1049"><span class="doxyHighlight">                         </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">bool</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> MatchIntrinsics = </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">true</span><span class="doxyHighlight">,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01050" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1050"><span class="doxyHighlight">                         </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">bool</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> MatchMustTailCalls = </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">true</span><span class="doxyHighlight">)</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01051" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1051"><span class="doxyHighlight">      : Mapper(&amp;InstDataAllocator, &amp;InstDataListAllocator),</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01052" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1052"><span class="doxyHighlight">        EnableBranches(MatchBranches), EnableIndirectCalls(MatchIndirectCalls),</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01053" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1053"><span class="doxyHighlight">        EnableMatchingCallsByName(MatchCallsWithName),</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01055" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1055"><span class="doxyHighlight">        EnableMustTailCalls(MatchMustTailCalls) &#123;&#125;</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01106" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1106"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// the SimilarityCandidates to make sure we do not have only old values</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01108" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1108"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">if</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (SimilarityCandidates)</span></CodeLine>
